post.author: Mike
post.title: Save Those Air Miles on Your Next Flight?
post.content:
Photo: Salar de Uyuni, Bolivia via Shutterstock


Anyone who has been carefully collecting and saving airline miles for more travel hopes to get the most value when it comes time to book flights with airline miles. After all, what is the point of accumulating them if they can't be used? However, there are times when using those miles can not only be a hassle, but can result in not getting the best deal. Let's look at how to get the most when you book flights with airline miles.

It can be tricky to decipher mileage plans when it comes time to book flights with airline miles. Blackout dates, restrictions and more can be a problem. However, there are ways around this, and there are ways to get creative with miles to get the most out of them.

One of the best things anyone can do when it comes to mileage programs is to know them inside and out. There is usually quite a bit of fine print, and not all mileage programs are created equal. Each plan has its quirks, advantages and disadvantages. The more people know about their plan, the better they can use it to their advantage. It is disappointing when a traveler goes to book flights with airline miles, only to find that they can't use them when they need to. Some key things to keep in mind:

  • How long to the miles last? Unfortunately, many people allow their miles to expire before they get a chance to use them.
  • What kind of restrictions are involved?
  • What kind of availability is there for mileage seats? How far in advance should the flight be booked if using miles?

When it comes to getting the most bang for the buck, so to speak, it seems that one of the best ways to spend those miles is on longer, international flights. Another way to get more value when you book flights with airline miles is to book business or first-class.

The reason for this is that a lower-priced flight purchased with fewer miles equals out to less value per mile than a more expensive flight. When it comes to down to it, it makes more sense to pay cash for the cheaper flight, thus accumulating more miles to pay for the expensive flight later on. Before a person goes to book flights with airline miles, they should figure the actual value per mile that they are getting. 

Sometimes, it just doesn't work out to book flights with airline miles. Instead of letting them go to waste, there are other ways to spend those miles. Oftentimes, miles can be used for hotel rooms (perfect for a local weekend getaway) or other purchases. They can also be sold, traded and donated.

Remember to pay attention to restrictions, black-out dates and be aware of when miles expire. It will be frustrating to try to book flights with airline miles if they have expired or there are no seats available.
